text: is one of three wards of the city of Shizuoka. The municipality was "Shimizu City" until it merged with Shizuoka in 2005. "Shimizu," Encyuclopedia Britannica; retrieved 2012-9-26. ==History== Shimizu developed around its good natural harbor. In the Edo period, , , and were the 15-18th of the 53 shogunate-maintained waystations (shuku-eki) along the Tōkaidō road which connected Edo and Kyoto. These four way-stations were in the area of modern Shimizu.Nussbaum, "Tōkaidō" at p. 973. ==Geography== Shimizu is located on the coast of Suruga Bay of the Pacific Ocean. ==Related pages== * The Fifty-three Stations of the Tōkaidō ==References== ==Other websites== Category:Settlements in Shizuoka Prefecture
title: Shimizu-ku, Shizuoka
